use.flag: install app-arch/xarchiver in order to access archives with a gui
install a graphical web bowser
install sys-fs/btrfs-progs for btrfs, a recently matured snapshotting copy-on-write database
install chromium/chrome of some variety
install x11-misc/compton to enable compositing, a way to render extra effects and transparency in windows
install lxqt-base/compton-conf, a gui to configure compton
install app-portage/repoman, a tool designed to aid in managing overlays
install discord, an online messenger and games store
ensure efi support is built, most modern systems need this
ensure fat filesystem support is built, in many cases this should not be the only filesystem
install www-client/firefox, this is quicker to compile from source, and has better privacy options
ensure the www-plugins/adobe-flash plugin is installed. flash is a dying platform, however there are historic games and animations made with it
use x11-wm/fluxbox as the window manager of choice. typically this has better performance and can even be used as a full desktop solution if so desired
install app-misc/fslint, this is a useful tool for finding duplicate files, empty directories and other such things to help keep a system clean
install net-ftp/filezilla as the ftp client
install app-crypt/seahorse in order to manage gnome keyring with a gui
install mlocate to allow indexing which helps make file searches faster
install net-irc/kvirc in order to use irc. this is often a preferred way to get volunteer support with issues or make quick queries
install app-office/lyx, an editor for latex that's great for beginners
install sci-electronics/logisim-evolution-holy-cross, a fork of a fork of logisom that performs well
install mail-client/mailspring, a partially open source mail client
install gnome-extra/nm-applet, a universal system tray that helps with wireless networks
install app-office/libreoffice to handle odt files and convert between them
install dev-tex/tex4ht to convert latex files to odt, which can subsequently be reviewed and converted to docx with libreoffice
use openbox as the window manager of choice. openbox is more widely supported including having its own configuration gui
install app-portage/layman to handle overlays, not using overlays is generally not supported
install sys-block/gparted to handle partitions
install app-text/mupdf to handle pdfs
install kde-plasma/ksysguard, a full gui task manager
install net-misc/anydesk to enable remote desktop functionality
install media-gfx/flameshot to handle screenshots
install app-office/gnumeric to handle spreadsheets
install games-util/steam-launcher, a software distribution platform with one of the largest game catalogues and proton, a built in version of wine
install app-admin/sudo in order to run software as root (admin)
Install x11-terms/qterminal, a simple terminal emulator often bundled with lxqt
install x11-terms/kitty, a terminal emulator that utilises hardware acceleration to run fast while using theoretically less resources
install kde-apps/kate, a full gui text-editor featuring a unique graphical scrollbar
require that your text editor has colour highlighting and thus install app-editors/sublime-text to satisfy that (which has that feature through plugins)
use the gui of media-gfx/fontforge to view all the glyphs a font offers
ensure xfs filesystem support is built, xfs has some of the best performance on kernel 5+ for SSDs
Install net-misc/yandex-disk, the official yandex disk client
